documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
ertain circumstances, our moral principles conflictwith
one another, and people are inclined to resolve these conflicts in different
ways. People often agree on principles about welfare, justice, and human
dignity, and yet, by weighing these principles differently or seeing the situa-
tion in a different light, they arrive at opposing moral conclusions.
Another  kind  of  moral  disagreement  concerns  the  rangeor scopeof
moral  principles.  Even  if  everyone  agrees  that  death  and  sufferi
